person.note: Lv Zuqian [7055] Haowen's [8099] great grandson, Bengzhong's [1320] grandson, Han Yuanji's [669] son-in-law. Zeng Ji [1692] was the father-in-law of his father, Daqi [3652]. His maternal great grandfather was Fang Meng [7220], who was also his uncle Datong's [3653] grandfather-in-law. Zuqian was a friend of Wu Fei's [1970] son, Hong [4015]. His younger brother and Zeng Ji's [1692] grandson-in-law, Zujian [3655], was appointed Taifu sicheng in 1194 but was cashiered from the service and exiled to Yunzhou, a remote area of Kiangsi, in 1195 when he opposed the replacement of Chief minister of state, Zhao Ruyu [3200], with Han Tuozhou [3326], Han Qi's [630] great grandson. Zujian's younger brother, Zutai [3656], who had moved from Jinhua xian to Changzhou, Yixing xian, went to the Petitioners Drum Bureau in 1196 when Zujian died and petitioned that Han Tuozhou was disloyal and should be put to death in order to prevent disorder. He also asked that Su(1) Shidan [3768] be executed, Chen Ziqiang [3092] dismissed and Zhou Bida [7197] appointed Chief minister of state. He was exiled to Qinzhou(b) on the coast of the South China sea, but recalled when Han Tuochou was executed. Chen Fuliang, WJ, 18.11b-12a; Lu Zuqian, WJ, 7.155-7 (jishi (wife #2 ?), born Han, who died in 1171 at age 27), 8.193 (jishi (wife #3), born Rui, who died in 1179 at age 18); SHY:ZG, 73.19b-20a; Jingding Yanzhou xuzhi, 3.5a. CBD, 2, 1212-5.From Hartwell's ACTIVITY table:1169: Arrived at post as superintendant of the Yanzhou prefectural school1170: Replacement arrived as superintendant of Yanzhou prefectural school.
